author: Ryan Mancini
description: President Trump on Saturday said Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado “doesn’t have the support” within Venezuela to be its next leader after U.S. troops captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, and said she was not consulted prior to the operation. “I think it would be very tough for her to be the leader,” Trump said…
title: Trump says Machado ‘doesn’t have the support’ in Venezuela, wasn’t consulted

author: Ella Lee
description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, face cocaine importation conspiracy charges and other counts in an indictment newly unsealed Saturday after their capture.   The four-count superseding indictment, which also charges other Venezuelan government officials and allies, alleges Maduro leveraged government power to protect and promote vast criminal conduct — from drug trafficking to terrorism — for the benefit of himself and his allies.   “This cycle of narcotics-based corruption lines…
title: Maduro, wife face new indictment: What we know about the case

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Saturday warned Cuba’s leaders that “I’d be concerned” following the United States’ capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro during an attack earlier in the day. Rubio spoke to reporters at a press conference at President Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida. The secretary accused Cuba of being “run by incompetent,…
title: Rubio sends warning to Cuba’s leaders after Maduro’s removal: ‘I’d be concerned’

author: Laura Kelly
description: Republican lawmakers’ reactions to President Trump’s arrest and indictment of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Saturday spanned the spectrum of the GOP. Trump’s stalwart allies and Latin American hawks cheered the shocking operation while the president’s few critics in the party rebuked the military action. The near unanimity among Republicans stood in stark contrast to…
title: Republicans rally around Trump Venezuela operation, with few detractors

author: Anne Zimmerman and Nikki Rohloff, opinion contributors
description: Small business owners face a tilted playing field when it comes to taxes, as large corporations are able to utilize sophisticated tax shelters to minimize their tax burden while small businesses are forced to pay every cent owed.
title: Who wins when the IRS stops enforcement? Not small business.

author: Matthew Zachary, opinion contributor
description: America's sick will decide the 2026 midterm elections, as the American health care system is designed to put profits over patients and two-thirds of all bankruptcies are medical, while ACA premiums are expected to rise 114 percent in 2026.
title: The next election will be decided by America’s sick

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Palantir has seen its portfolio of government contracts mushroom in President Trump’s second term, but the company is also facing growing scrutiny over its work with the administration, particularly its assistance with controversial immigration efforts. The software company, which focuses on data analytics, is not unfamiliar with controversy, given long-standing accusations that its tools are…
title: Palantir courts major federal contracts — and controversy — in Trump era

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: Over the last six months, I have had multiple people with a deep understanding of the sports world volunteer a truly dejected and disgusted version of the same complaint: “I Just don’t trust sports anymore.” Each complaint revolves around the explosion in gambling, which is not only tainting the greater sports world but also ensnaring…
title: ‘You bet’ — why they just don’t trust sports anymore

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The U.S. will be “very strongly involved” in Venezuela’s oil industry, President Trump said Saturday after the capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. Asked about the future of the country’s oil industry on Fox News’s “Fox & Friends”, Trump said, “Well, I see that we’re going to be very strongly involved in it.” “We have the…
title: Trump says the US will be ‘very strongly involved’ in Venezuelan oil

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) on Saturday questioned the legality of the Trump administration’s strikes on Venezuela, which ended with the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores. “If this action were constitutionally sound, the Attorney General wouldn’t be tweeting that they’ve arrested the President of a sovereign country and his wife…
title: Massie questions legality of Trump’s action in Venezuela

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump posted a photo of captured Venezuelan President Nicholas Maduro aboard the USS Iwo Jima on Saturday. The photo, posted to his Truth Social account, shows Maduro dressed in a sweatshirt and sweatpants with what looks like headphones and dark glasses placed over his eyes. The Venezuelan leader is also holding a water bottle…
title: Trump posts photo of Maduro on US ship headed to New York

author: Julia Manchester
description: Florida Republicans widely lauded President Trump’s operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicholas Maduro on Saturday, citing the state’s strong ties to the South American nation.  “A new day is here for Venezuela and Latin America,” Sen. Rick Scott (R-Fla.) said in a post on X. “The United States and our hemisphere are safer because of…
title: Florida Republicans laud Trump over Maduro capture

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump’s shocking operation capturing Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife polarized the international community on Saturday. Exiled opposition figures welcomed the overthrow of a dictator, while authoritarians cried foul and democratic leaders fretted over the precedent. In Latin America, Trump’s critics condemned the U.S. military operation as a call back to American interventionism…
title: Trump’s Venezuela operation polarizes world leaders

author: Addy Bink
description: (NEXSTAR) – Whether or not your driver’s license or state identification card has one small feature on it could determine whether you’ll be asked to fork over $45 before your flight in 2026. Roughly two decades ago, legislation was enacted to create a national minimum requirement for state driver’s licenses and ID cards. In spring…
title: No REAL ID? Why you may want to get one in 2026

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump will give remarks Saturday morning after the U.S. military conducted strikes in Venezuela and captured its leader, Nicolas Maduro. Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, have been indicted on narco-terrorism charges in New York, the Trump administration announced. The president, in an interview with Fox News, detailed the military operation. He confirmed that…
title: Watch live: Trump gives remarks on US strikes in Venezuela

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.), the ranking member of the Senate Foreign Relations Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere, on Saturday said the military attack on Venezuela and the arrest of its leader, Nicolás Maduro, was “unauthorized” and called on Congress to reassert its authority. “President Trump’s unauthorized military attack on Venezuela to arrest Maduro—however terrible he…
title: Kaine: Trump conducted ‘unauthorized’ military attack on Venezuela

author: Jesse Byrnes
description: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-Ark.) on Saturday said the Trump administration did not notify congressional leaders ahead of its operation to arrest and remove Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro even as he defended the decision. “That’s probably one reason it didn’t leak over these four days as they were waiting for the right weather,” Cotton, the chair…
title: Cotton defends lack of congressional notification for Maduro operation

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump provided the first details of the U.S. operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicholas Maduro during a Saturday morning interview on Fox News, also confirming that two American personnel and a helicopter were hit during the overnight raid. “I think we had nobody killed, I have to say because a couple of guys were…
title: Trump describes capture of Maduro on Fox News; says 2 US troops, helicopter hit

author: Ian Swanson
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) concluded a post on X reacting to the U.S. military attack on Venezuela and the capture of Nicolas Madura with two words: “Free Cuba.” The veteran senator and foreign policy hawk hailed the operation, arguing it was in the U.S. interest to “bring justice” to Venezuela and deal with a drug…
title: Graham says ‘Free Cuba’ in response to Maduro capture, Venezuela attack

author: Y. Tony Yang, opinion contributor
description: Most Americans have never thought much about hepatitis B, and that's precisely because the vaccine works so well.
title: America forgets how deadly hepatitis B is. Taiwan offers lessons.

author: Joseph Webster, opinion contributor
description: There are alternatives to accepting a recession or transferring advanced technology to China.
title: SAFE Chips Act avoids a false choice on the economy and national security

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: Democratic lawmakers lambasted the administration early Saturday after President Trump announced U.S. personnel captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores, flew them of the South American nation and carried out a “large scale” strike in the country. The move, many argued, was “illegal” without congressional approval. Sen. Andy Kim (D-N.J.) specifically called out…
title: Democrats rip Trump administration for ‘illegal’ strikes on Venezuela

author: Ian Swanson
description: Russia is offering stark criticism of the U.S. military attack on Venezuela, which resulted in the capture of President Nicolas Maduro. In response, Russia called for a full meeting of the United Nations Security Council. “This morning, the United States carried out an act of armed aggression against Venezuela. This causes deep concern and condemnation,”…
title: Russia harshly criticizes US attack on Venezuela, capture of Maduro

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump said that United States personnel captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife and were flown out of the country as the U.S. military carried out “large scale” strike inside the nation in the early morning hours on Saturday, an operation that came after a monthslong standoff between the two leaders.  “This operation was…
title: Trump says Maduro captured, flown out as US military conducts ‘large scale’ strike

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former New York City mayoral candidate Curtis Sliwa (R) defended Mayor Zohran Mamdani (D) ahead of his swearing-in, but described the recent meeting between him and President Trump as them being “actors” in a “love-fest.” Sliwa spoke for an interview with The Wall Street Journal on Monday. When asked if he would have other New…
title: Curtis Sliwa defends Mamdani, chalks up Trump ‘love-fest’ to them both being ‘actors’

author: Ryan Mancini
description: President Trump on Friday shared an AI-generated image mocking Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D), the latest in his feud with the governor since his return to the White House almost one year ago. The image shared on Truth Social depicts Pritzker in a city, surrounded by flames and homeless encampments around him, with people lying…
title: Trump insults Pritzker with AI-generated social media post

description: Former Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) on Friday said congressional lawmakers are retiring because “nothing is happening” on Capitol Hill. “If nothing’s being accomplished — because they are making a sacrifice, they’re being away from their family, sometimes it’s a long travel, you get harassed, you get death threats, all the different things — but you’re…
title: McCarthy says lawmakers heading for the door because ‘nothing is happening’
